alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 3:53PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Greeley and Valley Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 353 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Comstock to 7 miles south of Greeley. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Greeley and Valley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
